etymologies: 1950s: abstracted from such words as phonemic (see phoneme) and systemic

definitions: relating to or denoting an approach to the study or description of a particular language or culture in terms of its internal elements and their functioning rather than in terms of any existing external framework

examples.text: accurate ethnographic description from an internal or emic perspective, from the native point of view

shortDefinitions: denoting approach to study or description of a particular language or culture in terms of its internal elements
